title: Lower Chattahoochee Regional Airport
text:
Lower Chattahoochee Regional Airport is a county-owned, public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> located four <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (5 <a href="mile">mi</a>, 7 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) southwest of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Cuthbert%2C%20Georgia">Cuthbert</a>, a city in <a href="Randolph%20County%2C%20Georgia">Randolph County, Georgia</a>, United States. It was formerly known as Cuthbert-Randolph Airport. This airport is included in the <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2011–2015, which <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility.
Facilities and aircraft.
Lower Chattahoochee Regional Airport covers an area of 46 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (19 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 457 feet (139 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 18/36 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 3,000 by 60 feet (914 x 18 m). For the 12-month period ending June 23, 2010, the airport had 2,000 <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> aircraft operations, an average of 38 per week.
